org.jlab.coda.emu

Class EmuEventNotify

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.emu.EmuEventNotify

  • public class EmuEventNotify
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is designed for allowing the Emu to wait until a DataChannel or Transport or Module has received a desired event. An object of this class can only be used once (created and then endWait() called), before the reset() method needs to be called in order to be able to call endWait() again.
    Author:
    timmer Date: 4/22/13

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmuEventNotify()
      Constructor with default wait time of 1 seconds.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void endWait()
      This method allows the waitForEvent() method to return immediately.
      void reset()
      This method enables reuse of this object.
      void waitForEvent()
      This method waits indefinitely for the endWait() method to be called before it returns.
      boolean waitForEvent(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
      This method waits for the endWait() method to be called or for the timeout to expire before it returns.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EmuEventNotify

        public EmuEventNotify()
        Constructor with default wait time of 1 seconds.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method enables reuse of this object. Call this before endWait and waitForEvent.

      • endWait

        public void endWait()
        This method allows the waitForEvent() method to return immediately.

      • waitForEvent

        public void waitForEvent()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method waits indefinitely for the endWait() method to be called before it returns.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted during wait

      • waitForEvent

        public boolean waitForEvent(long timeout,
                            java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
                     throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method waits for the endWait() method to be called or for the timeout to expire before it returns.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        true if endWait() called and false if the waiting time elapsed before endWait() called
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interrupted during wait
